definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals

sentences.english: Your willingness to sacrifice countless late nights consoling them?
sentences.chinese: 或者是因为你愿意花费无数的夜晚去安慰他们？

sentences.english: They could even count the fruit in Soviet orchards and analyze their crops.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至可以数出苏联果园里的果树并分析其产量。

sentences.english: Other violence occurred at Friendship Road and at Liberation Road, they said.
sentences.chinese: 他们说还有其它的暴力事件发生在友谊路和解放大道。

sentences.english: Garden Cottages are a favorite of brides for their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 花园的别墅是他们的新婚之夜新娘最喜爱的一种。

sentences.english: They love to run about on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢在海滩上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: They're less likely to nitpick about details that aren't relevant at this stage.
sentences.chinese: 减少他们在与主题不相关的细节上的吹毛求疵。

sentences.english: Perhaps they spent time in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们在院子里打发时光。

sentences.english: We are committed to help them do the latter.
sentences.chinese: 我们承诺将帮助他们化敌为友。

sentences.english: They must have strong longings that lures them to attend MEC.
sentences.chinese: 他们一定有很强烈的渴望促使他们参加英语角。

sentences.english: They must have strong longings that lures them to attend MEC.
sentences.chinese: 他们一定有很强烈的渴望促使他们参加英语角。

sentences.english: The weather became so bad that they had to turn back.
sentences.chinese: 天气变得很坏，他们只好原路而归了。

sentences.english: All of them insisted on my staying with them a few days longer.
sentences.chinese: 他们所有的人都坚持要我再跟他们多呆几天时间。

sentences.english: All of them insisted on my staying with them a few days longer.
sentences.chinese: 他们所有的人都坚持要我再跟他们多呆几天时间。

sentences.english: They will study at home on computers.
sentences.chinese: 他们将在家用电脑上课。

sentences.english: What the little boys didn't know was that a second train was heading straight for them.
sentences.chinese: 另一列火车正朝他们驶过来，两个小男孩却浑然不知。

sentences.english: They are marching off to gyms and discovering face cream in record numbers.
sentences.chinese: 他们向健身房进军，物色到的面霜数目已创历史新高。

definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
